intro: Verticordia eriocephala, commonly known as the pink burr-lilly, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its unique, pinkish-red floral spikes that are often covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to the region's dry climate. Its flowers are clustered in dense, rounded heads, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is a member of the family Proteaceae and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture.
